output.conclusion: This course provided an intermediate-level overview of power systems, covering generation, transmission, distribution, and protection. Further study is recommended for specialized areas.
output.introduction: Welcome to Power Systems! This course provides an intermediate-level understanding of the fundamental principles and components of modern power systems. We will explore generation, transmission, distribution, and protection aspects.

chapters.description: Introduction to various power generation methods: thermal, hydro, nuclear, and renewable energy sources. Basic principles and efficiency considerations.
Construction, operation, and equivalent circuit of synchronous generators. Voltage regulation and power angle characteristics.
Overview of power plant control systems, including automatic generation control (AGC) and load frequency control (LFC).
Calculation of resistance, inductance, and capacitance of transmission lines. Effects of conductor geometry and transposition.
Short, medium, and long transmission line models. ABCD parameters and their significance.
Introduction to power flow studies. Gauss-Seidel and Newton-Raphson methods for solving power flow equations.
Overview of distribution transformers, feeders, and protective devices. Radial and loop distribution systems.
Calculation of voltage drop and power loss in distribution systems. Techniques for voltage regulation and loss reduction.
Introduction to SCADA systems and smart grid technologies for distribution system monitoring and control.
Symmetrical and unsymmetrical faults in power systems. Calculation of fault currents using symmetrical components.
Principles of overcurrent, distance, and differential relays. Coordination of protective devices.
Types of circuit breakers and their operating characteristics. Arc interruption techniques.
